lines.content: ListBot is a task management system designed to help you keep track of your to-dos, deadlines, and events. With simple commands, you can easily add, mark, and organize your tasks directly from the command line.
The todo command adds a simple task with no deadline.
To add a deadline to your task list, use the deadline command, followed by the task description and the /by argument to specify when the deadline is due.
To add an event, use the event command along with /from and /to to specify the start and end time.
Added: 3.[E][ ] Lecture FROM: Friday 16:00 TO: Friday 18:00
To mark a task as complete: `mark 2`
This marks the task at index 2 as complete.
To unmark a task as complete: `unmark 2`
This unmarks the task at index 2 as complete.
This deletes the task at index 1.
To search for tasks by keyword:
Your list has been saved successfully.
Let me know if I can help again!
Any unrecognized commands will print an error message and the correct syntax.
This is an invalid delete statement.
For list of all valid instructions: help

ListBot is a task management system designed to help you keep track of your to-dos, deadlines, and events. With simple commands, you can easily add, mark, and organize your tasks directly from the command line.
The todo command adds a simple task with no deadline.
To add a deadline to your task list, use the deadline command, followed by the task description and the /by argument to specify when the deadline is due.
To add an event, use the event command along with /from and /to to specify the start and end time.
Added: 3.[E][ ] Lecture FROM: Friday 16:00 TO: Friday 18:00
To mark a task as complete: `mark 2`
This marks the task at index 2 as complete.
To unmark a task as complete: `unmark 2`
This unmarks the task at index 2 as complete.
This deletes the task at index 1.
To search for tasks by keyword:
Your list has been saved successfully.
Let me know if I can help again!
Any unrecognized commands will print an error message and the correct syntax.
This is an invalid delete statement.
For list of all valid instructions: help
* The ListBot class serves as the entry point of the application.
* It initializes the task list and starts taking user input for managing tasks.
* The main method initializes the task list and begins user input parsing.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during task initialization or input handling.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* The Parser class handles user input and processes various commands
* such as adding tasks, marking/unmarking tasks, and exiting the application.
* Takes input from the user and processes commands in a continuous loop.
* The loop runs until the user enters the "bye" command, which will
* clear the task list, save the data, and exit the program.
* @throws IOException if there is an issue with input/output operations during saving.
public static void takeInput() throws IOException {
* Processes the "mark" and "unmark" commands to update the status of tasks
* in the task list. It handles both valid and invalid task indices.
* @param command the user input containing either "mark" or "unmark" followed by a task index.
* The Storage class handles file operations such as saving, loading, and clearing tasks
* from a text file. It works with a file that stores the task list in the local system and
* Initializes the storage system. It checks if the save file exists, creates it if necessary,
* and loads the file contents into the task list.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during file creation or loading.
public static void init() throws IOException {
* Clears the contents of the save file, removing all stored tasks.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during file writing.
public static void clear() throws IOException {
* Appends a specified text string to the save file, used to save tasks in a formatted way.
* @param textToAppend The text to append to the save file.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during file writing.
public static void appendToFile(String textToAppend) throws IOException {
* Loads the content of the save file into memory, converting it back into task objects
* and adding them to the task list.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during file reading.
public static void loadFile() throws IOException {
* Converts the contents of the save file into tasks and adds them to the task list.
* @param fileContent The full content of the save file as a string.
* Saves the current tasks from the task list to the save file in a formatted manner. Each task
* is converted to a string that can later be parsed when loading.
return; // Exception handling during save process.
* Formats a task string by converting task details into a savable format for the save file.
* This method modifies the task string by replacing certain characters with file-friendly markers
* @param taskString The original string representation of the task.
* @return A formatted string ready to be written to the save file.
String stringToWrite = taskString.substring(3); // Strips first 3 characters
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks, including adding, deleting, and marking tasks.
* It supports three types of tasks: ToDo, Deadline, and Event.
* The Task class represents a general task with a description, status (done or not done), and task number.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns the status icon for the task.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" if it is not done
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return a formatted string showing the status icon and task description
* The Deadline class represents a task with a deadline.
public static class Deadline extends TaskList.Task {
* @param description the description of the deadline task
private Deadline(String description, int taskNum, String by) {
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return a formatted string showing task details and deadline
* The ToDo class represents a task without any date or time constraint.
public static class ToDo extends TaskList.Task {
* @param description the description of the to-do task
* Returns the string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return a formatted string showing task details
* The Event class represents a task that spans a time period.
public static class Event extends TaskList.Task {
* @param description the description of the event task
* @param from the start time of the event
* @param to the end time of the event
private Event(String description, int taskNum, String from, String to) {
* Returns the string representation of the Event task.
* @return a formatted string showing task details and event time period
return (this.taskNum + 1) + ".[E]" + super.toString() + " FROM: " + from + " TO: " + to;
* Initializes the task list, sets up storage, and prints the initial user interface entry.

TaskList.Task newTask = new TaskList.Event(words[0].substring(6), listCount, words[1], words[2]);

public static void addTaskFromSave(String taskType, String taskStatus, String taskDesc) {

* Searches the task list for tasks containing the specified keyword in their description.
* @param keyword the search query that will be used to find matching tasks. The keyword is extracted from the full input string.
* The Ui class handles all user interface operations. It provides methods to display
* messages to the user and confirm various operations, such as adding, marking, unmarking,
* or deleting tasks. It also handles error messages for invalid commands or inputs.
* Prints the entry message when the application starts.
* It welcomes the user and provides a brief instruction on how to get help.
System.out.println("I am ListBot, how can I help?");
System.out.println("For list of all valid instructions: help");
* Prints a line separator to enhance the readability of the console output.
* Prints the exit message when the user decides to quit the application.
* It confirms that the list has been saved and says goodbye to the user.
System.out.println("Your list has been saved successfully.");
System.out.println("Let me know if I can help again!");
* Prints a confirmation message after successfully adding a task to the list.
* It also clears the storage and saves the updated task list.
* @param task The task that has been added.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during saving.
public static void printAddConfirm(TaskList.Task task) throws IOException {
* Prints a confirmation message after successfully marking a task as completed.
* It also clears the storage and saves the updated task list.
* @param task The task that has been marked.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during saving.
public static void printMarkConfirm(TaskList.Task task) throws IOException {
* Prints a confirmation message after successfully unmarking a task as incomplete.
* It also clears the storage and saves the updated task list.

* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during saving.
public static void printUnmarkConfirm(TaskList.Task task) throws IOException {
* Prints a confirmation message after successfully deleting a task from the list.
* It also clears the storage and saves the updated task list.
* @param task The task that has been deleted.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during saving.
public static void printDeleteConfirm(TaskList.Task task) throws IOException {
